1.specific_issue_units: Annual Emergency Department Visits (Adults) Per 10,000 Residents

specific_issue_description.text: Asthma is a chronic lung disease. Air pollution generated by car traffic both

. Asthma interferes with the ability to breathe, exercise, play, work, and sleep, and can lead to school and work absences, permanent narrowing of bronchial tubes, and life-threatening attacks requiring hospitalization.
New York children have asthma. Low-income Black and Latino neighborhoods have
. Neighborhoods with
and lower traffic volume have

1.specific_issue_sentence: A sentence description about the issue consequat mauris nunc.
1.specific_issue_ranking_narrative: Ranking narrative (prose version) community district 1 is worst performing. A sentence on Bike Racks. news bite/ headlines. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod.

base_text.text: To reduce asthma rates in your neighborhood, pay attention to the design and use of public spaces in your neighborhood. Here are a few ways you can improve spatial equity:

solutions_list.text: Create a “clean air

” to reduce childhood asthma rates by converting one block outside a school in your district into a car-free pedestrian space. In New York City, restricting car access more than halved air pollution both following the pedestrianization of
and of Park Avenue during
. In London, car-free “school streets” reduced vehicle-related air pollution

Designate a “crisis zone” in districts with high asthma rates and low tree cover. Narrow streets, insert curb extensions, and depave 10 percent of all parking spots to create space for extensive tree planting in these districts. One tree can remove
annually, equivalent to $5.60 in benefits for every dollar that New York City spends planting trees.
Launch a “driving alternatives” initiative to shift trips out of cars and trucks in high asthma districts, including the installation of
and
on high-traffic streets and the creation of
. Researchers have found that
and
can reduce
and asthma hospitalizations. After Stockholm reduced traffic volumes with a congestion toll,
solutions_list.hyperlink: asthma rates fell more than 50 percent
